content:
After a two-year hiatus due to the pandemic, Bucks Beautiful is pleased to announce the return of the annual Spring Fling Gala.  The first social event of the spring season will be held at the historic Inn at Barley Sheaf Farm on Friday April 8th, 2022 at 6 pm.  

“With the help of community partners, what started as a small backyard gathering has developed into a sellout evening event,” said Gary Mathern, Board President.  Guests will enjoy dining in the country elegance of the 19th Century Stone Bank Barn, located at 5281 York Road in Holicong. 

The enchanting evening will include cocktails, seated dinner, silent auction, live auction, wine pull and raffle.  The Master of Ceremonies will be Emmy Award Winner Grover Silcox, PBS 39 Reporter and “Counter Culture” Host, with DJ services provided by Geoff Panettieri of Party Scene Events.

Proceeds will benefit our reforestation initiative RePlant Bucks, the Bulbs for Bucks daffodil plantings, scholarship and educational programs and community garden projects throughout the county.  Funds raised previously allowed us to install 500 indigenous trees, 100,000 more daffodils, support new school outdoor classrooms designed with native plantings, create beautiful plantings at our nursing homes, parks, museums, war memorials and more.

Please RSVP as soon as possible as seating is limited.  Tickets can be purchased online at www.bucksbeautiful.org or by phone at 215-340-3639.  To become an event sponsor or donate an auction item contact Susan@bucksbeautiful.org.  Thank you for helping us grow!

Bucks Beautiful is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that coordinates events, community projects and educational programs.  We create partnerships with like-minded civic coalitions to develop attractive yet sustainable vistas to foster a healthier environment.  Since 1991 we have worked to enhance the local landscape for residents and visitors alike by beautifying our towns, schools, parks, roadsides and pathways throughout Bucks County.
